page.title: 12GOOSTREY SCHOOL _ GAMES
page.content: At playtime at Goostrey School many different games are played. One of the favourites is 'ELASTIC'. Two people stand facing each other with a loop of elastic stretched between them. They start with it round their ankles and increase the height as the game progresses. Several other children take turns doing a series of jumps onto or in between the elastic.When a jump is done wrongly that child takes over holding the elastic. More traditional games include various forms of chasing, informal football, skipping and 'Pig in the middle'. The blank wall is used for throwing and catching games. 'DONKEY' involves throwing the ball at the wall and jumping over it before it bounces. Any child failing is given'D','O','N' etc. in turn and after 'Y' is 'OUT'.
